derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French mahaignier, of unknown origin

entry.def: To maim someone means to injure them so badly that part of their body is permanently damaged.

example.ex: Mines have been scattered in rice paddies and jungles, maiming and killing civilians...
example.tran: 地雷遍布稻田与林间，很多平民被炸死或炸成重伤。

example.ex: One man has lost his life, another has been maimed.
example.tran: 一名男子丧生，另一名重伤。

means.word_mean: 1. injure or wound seriously and leave permanent disfiguration or mutilation;
